title: Why has Urf come out the least compared to other game modes
body: It's been 10 weeks since we have seen Urf, Riot promised a return of every game mode between 1 and a 1/2 to 2 months. Yet it is still scheduled to not come for 3?

replies.body:
In all likelihood, URF was intended to make it's next appearance next weekend (22nd-25th), based on the schedule shown from 3 weeks ago [[link](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/rotating-game-mode-queue-now-live-10)] which shows that LotPK was planned for this weekend until later on when Riot came out with Nexus Siege. Given that we've had a new mode introduced it's logical that the standard workings of the Rotating Queue would get interrupted. So far, there's been no set rotation, with modes appearing in a seemingly random manner. Currently, the available modes are sitting on either 2 or 3 appearances in the queue, it's reasonable to assume we'll see URF at some point before any other mode get's it's 4th appearance.

As for the so-called "promise", it was never guaranteed. The actual statement is, and I quote, "Modes will *likely* repeat every 1.5~2 months.", emphasis on the "likely" [[link](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/JzQkg9BJ-rotating-game-mode-queue-update)]. I would also like to point out that this estimate was likely used as an average, indication that their intentions were to have each mode (that's included in the Rotating Queue) appear 6-8 times in any given year, not necessarily *literally* every 1.5-2 months.

where did they say every gamemode will come out 1-2 months apart?

Riot said URF would be available twice this year and it has been. You most likely won't be seeing it again in 2016.

They said 'at least' twice this year, and we will more than likely see URF again, but it was always meant to be one of the rarer gamemodes because it is one of the special ones. If we had it every other weekend we'd all get bored of it hella quick.
"every other weekend", you mean like 14 weeks.
